intro: Carex saxilittoralis, commonly known as the coastal sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to coastal regions of the northern hemisphere. It thrives in moist, sandy or gravelly soils, often found in salt marshes and dunes. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically green to bluish-green in color. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Carex saxilittoralis plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various insects and birds.
